desc.player: Gamble your hard earned coin playing Gwent here.
desc.warn: Warning, this player may disappear later in the game.

desc.foodDrinkAndGwent: Sells Gwent cards, food, and drink.

misc.liberated: This merchant appears after liberating the area.
misc.disappears: Disappears after progressing through story quests.

desc.lootableBattlefield: This battlefield can be looted for easy early game coin
desc.serpentineSilverSword: Viper School Diagram (2/2), below the chapel
desc.crystalSkull: From the Intro Video, unlocks a dialog with Yennifer at her 'The Last Wish' Quest. Can only be picked up if you haven't left White Orchard yet

desc.gwentCraftingAndHorse: Sells Gwent cards, crafting supplies, and Temerian: blinders, saddle, saddlebags, armour
desc.alchemyRunesAndFood: Sells runestones, alchemy supplies and food

desc.abandonedVillage: A few years ago, a group of armed men marched into this settlement. They butchered its inhabitants and burned down their homes. Not a soul has dwelt here since that black and bloody day
desc.brokenBridge: This bridge was destroyed by retreating Temerian troops during the Nilfgaardian attack. It was shoddily built to begin with. Good riddance
desc.woesongBridge: So named because of a girl who once would stand on the bridge and sing, waiting for her beloved's return
desc.sawmill: White Orchard is famous not only for its premium fruit, but also for the top-quality, furniture-grade lumber harvested from the Vulpine Woods
desc.mill: Carts haul grain from all the surrounding villages to White Orchard's mill
desc.nilfgaardianGarrison: This strategic point guards White Orchard's main river crossing. Nilfgaardian troops have taken it over
desc.cacklerBridge: Bridge named in honor of a woman who went mad from unfulfilled love. After her heart snapped, she spent all her days running up and down this bridge while laughing hysterically
desc.crossroads: The road splits here. One fork leads to Vizima, the other to Novigrad
desc.ford: Before the war, merchants and travelers would cross the river here. Now only Nilfgaardian soldiers traverse this path
desc.ransackedVillage: A band of soldiers attacked this village early one morning. They slaughtered most of the villagers in their beds, and the lucky few who fled to the woods in time had nothing left to return to
